thread.title_full: Forget Dorset, welcome to Clevedon: the real Broadchurch - Telegraph.co.uk

title: Forget Dorset, welcome to Clevedon: the real Broadchurch - Telegraph.co.uk
text:
Forget Dorset, welcome to Clevedon: the real Broadchurch Olivia Colman as D.S Ellie Miller and David Tennant as D.I Alec Hardy Credit: COLIN HUTTON/REX/Shutterstock Zoe Dare Hall 19 February 2017 • 6:00am 
W hen Broadchurch returns to our television screens this month for its third and final series, Dorset may steal the limelight as the location of the fictional town behind this Bafta-award-winning crime drama. But it is the Victorian seaside town of Clevedon in North Somerset, to the west of Bristol, that is the unsung hero. 
Clevedon provides the buildings and backdrops in many of Broadchurch’s key scenes, from the saltwater Marine Lake, the site of the burning boat in the first series, to Hill Road, which doubles as Broadchurch High Street. 
The 12th-century St Andrew’s Church is a regular fixture, as is Seeley’s newsagent, known to several million viewers as the offices of the “Broadchurch Echo”. Clevedon’s coastal walks, whose views across the Bristol Channel and Welsh coast inspired such writers as Coleridge, Tennyson and Thackeray, are frequently called on when a dramatic backdrop is...
